Bijak","details":"Contract that demonstrates NFT enumerability of Carbon VCUs","methods":{"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approves another address to transfer the given token ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per token at a given time. Can only be called by the token owner or an approved operator.","params":{"to":"address to be approved for the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be approved"}},"approveBurns(address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"approves buring of subtokens by the owner of the VCU","params":{"_VCUSerialIdx":"VCU serial index ","_amount":"Amount of tokens to burn","_forOwner":"for which VCU owner "}},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"Gets the balance of the specified address.","params":{"owner":"address to query the balance of"},"return":"uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address"},"baseURI()":{"details":"Returns the base URI set via {_setBaseURI}. This will be automatically added as a preffix in {tokenURI} to each token's URI, when they are non-empty.    * _Available since v2.5.0._"},"getApproved(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the approved address for a token ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the token ID does not exist.","params":{"tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to query the approval of"},"return":"address currently approved for the given token ID"},"gettokenIDtoSubtokenAddress(uint256)":{"details":"returns the SubToken contract address for that VCUSerialIdx","params":{"_VCUSerialIdx":"VCU serial index"}},"initialize()":{"details":"Constructor function."},"initialize(string,string)":{"details":"Constructor function"},"initializeConstruct(string,string,address,address)":{"details":"-  Constructor for CarbonVCU NFT","params":{"_VCUSubTokenFactory":"SubToken Factory address that is initialized \r      ","_creolSuper":"is the super user incharge of the Creol Smart contracting system","name":"Name of the VCU batch","symbol":"for VCU batch"}},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"details":"Tells whether an operator is approved by a given owner.","params":{"operator":"operator address which you want to query the approval of","owner":"owner address which you want to query the approval of"},"return":"bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner"},"isOffset(uint256)":{"details":"checks if a certain VCU is completely offset or not.","params":{"_VCUSerialIdx":"VCU serial index"}},"isOwner()":{"details":"Returns true if the caller is the current owner."},"mintVCU(address,uint256,string,uint256,string,uint256,string,string,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"mints VCU and immediately tokenizes using \"tokenizeVCU\"","params":{"_VCSRegistry":"Registry where credit is currently registered","_VCUClass":"VCU Class number","_VCUID":"ID of this VCU","_VCUSerialIdx":"Index of serial number","_VVBID":"VVBID number","_additionalCertInfo":"Any other certification info on VERRA \r","_endDate":"Epoch UTC end date of the VCU","_forOwner":"Owner to transfer VCU ownership to","_projectCountryCode":"Project Country Code","_projectIdentifier":"Project Identfier","_scopeNumber":"Scope number","_startDate":"Epoch UTC start date of the VCU","_tokenMetadata":"Metadata for this token. Can be reference to VERRA"}},"mintWithTokenURI(address,uint256,string)":{"details":"Function to mint tokens.","params":{"to":"The address that will receive the minted tokens.","tokenId":"The token id to mint.","tokenURI":"The token URI of the minted token."},"return":"A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful."},"name()":{"details":"Gets the token name.","return":"string representing the token name"},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"ownerOf(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the owner of the specified token ID.","params":{"tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to query the owner of"},"return":"address currently marked as the owner of the given token ID"},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"from":"current owner of the token","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred"}},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the _msgSender() to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"_data":"bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check","from":"current owner of the token","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred"}},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all tokens of the sender on their behalf.","params":{"approved":"representing the status of the approval to be set","to":"operator address to set the approval"}},"setNFTUri(string,uint256)":{"details":"Meant to be used to fix URIs of already deployed NFTs to match the ERC1155 standard and use an IPFS address","params":{"_VCUSerialIdx":"the token to change","_newTokenURI":"the new tokenURI address to NFTisTokenized"}},"setProxyAdmin(address)":{"details":"Meant to update the proxyAdmin address, that was added in new version.","params":{"_proxyAdmin":"new address of the proxyAdmin contract for the openzeppelin app entry"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas."},"symbol()":{"details":"Gets the token symbol.","return":"string representing the token symbol"},"tokenByIndex(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the token ID at a given index of all the tokens in this contract Reverts if the index is greater or equal to the total number of tokens.","params":{"index":"uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the tokens list"},"return":"uint256 token ID at the given index of the tokens list"},"tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256)":{"details":"Gets the token ID at a given index of the tokens list of the requested owner.","params":{"index":"uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the requested tokens list","owner":"address owning the tokens list to be accessed"},"return":"uint256 token ID at the given index of the tokens list owned by the requested address"},"tokenURI(uint256)":{"details":"Returns the URI for a given token ID. May return an empty string.     * If the token's URI is non-empty and a base URI was set (via {_setBaseURI}), it will be added to the token ID's URI as a prefix.     * Reverts if the token ID does not exist."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"Gets the total amount of tokens stored by the contract.","return":"uint256 representing the total amount of tokens"},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address. Usage of this method is discouraged, use {safeTransferFrom} whenever possible. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator.","params":{"from":"current owner of the token","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"updateVCUSubtokenFactory(address)":{"details":"Meant to update interface if it ever needs to change, although unlikely given it uses devdoc.author: Joshua Bijak
devdoc.details: Contract that demonstrates NFT enumerability of Carbon VCUs

approve(address,uint256).details: Approves another address to transfer the given token ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per token at a given time. Can only be called by the token owner or an approved operator.

params.to: address to be approved for the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be approved

approveBurns(address,uint256,uint256).details: approves buring of subtokens by the owner of the VCU

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params.owner: address to query the balance of

balanceOf(address).return: uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address

baseURI().details: Returns the base URI set via {_setBaseURI}. This will be automatically added as a preffix in {tokenURI} to each token's URI, when they are non-empty.    * _Available since v2.5.0._

getApproved(uint256).details: Gets the approved address for a token ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the token ID does not exist.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query the approval of

getApproved(uint256).return: address currently approved for the given token ID

gettokenIDtoSubtokenAddress(uint256).details: returns the SubToken contract address for that VCUSerialIdx

params._VCUSubTokenFactory: SubToken Factory address that is initialized
params._creolSuper: is the super user incharge of the Creol Smart contracting system
params.name: Name of the VCU batch

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Tells whether an operator is approved by a given owner.

params.operator: operator address which you want to query the approval of
params.owner: owner address which you want to query the approval of

isApprovedForAll(address,address).return: bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner

isOffset(uint256).details: checks if a certain VCU is completely offset or not.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

mintVCU(address,uint256,string,uint256,s.details: mints VCU and immediately tokenizes using "tokenizeVCU"

params._VCSRegistry: Registry where credit is currently registered
params._additionalCertInfo: Any other certification info on VERRA
params._endDate: Epoch UTC end date of the VCU
params._forOwner: Owner to transfer VCU ownership to
params._startDate: Epoch UTC start date of the VCU
params._tokenMetadata: Metadata for this token. Can be reference to VERRA

params.to: The address that will receive the minted tokens.
params.tokenURI: The token URI of the minted token.

mintWithTokenURI(address,uint256,string).return: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

ownerOf(uint256).details: Gets the owner of the specified token ID.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query the owner of

ownerOf(uint256).return: address currently marked as the owner of the given token ID

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the _msgSender() to be the owner, approved, or operator

params._data: bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all tokens of the sender on their behalf.

params.approved: representing the status of the approval to be set
params.to: operator address to set the approval

setNFTUri(string,uint256).details: Meant to be used to fix URIs of already deployed NFTs to match the ERC1155 standard and use an IPFS address

params._newTokenURI: the new tokenURI address to NFTisTokenized

setProxyAdmin(address).details: Meant to update the proxyAdmin address, that was added in new version.

params._proxyAdmin: new address of the proxyAdmin contract for the openzeppelin app entry

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

tokenByIndex(uint256).details: Gets the token ID at a given index of all the tokens in this contract Reverts if the index is greater or equal to the total number of tokens.

params.index: uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the tokens list

tokenByIndex(uint256).return: uint256 token ID at the given index of the tokens list

tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256).details: Gets the token ID at a given index of the tokens list of the requested owner.

params.index: uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the requested tokens list
params.owner: address owning the tokens list to be accessed

tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256).return: uint256 token ID at the given index of the tokens list owned by the requested address

tokenURI(uint256).details: Returns the URI for a given token ID. May return an empty string.     * If the token's URI is non-empty and a base URI was set (via {_setBaseURI}), it will be added to the token ID's URI as a prefix.     * Reverts if the token ID does not exist.

totalSupply().details: Gets the total amount of tokens stored by the contract.
totalSupply().return: uint256 representing the total amount of tokens

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address. Usage of this method is discouraged, use {safeTransferFrom} whenever possible. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator.

params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateVCUSubtokenFactory(address).details: Meant to update interface if it ever needs to change, although unlikely given it uses Proxies

params._newVCUTokenFactory: Address for new VCUSubTokenFactoryInterface to be used

devdoc.title: CarbonVCU NFT

approveBurns(address,uint256,uint256).notice: currently this is handled by creolSuper but will change to an ACL contract later

gettokenIDtoSubtokenAddress(uint256).notice: this is  mapped against unique numbers

initializeConstruct(string,string,addres.notice: Deploys a new batch of CarbonVCU NFTs that have Metadata enabled

isOffset(uint256).notice: this loops through the contracts and can use a LOT of gas

mintVCU(address,uint256,string,uint256,s.notice: Mint a new VCU using VCS details

setNFTUri(string,uint256).notice: Uses internal _setTokenURI function to achieve this

setProxyAdmin(address).notice: Meant to update the proxyAdmin address, that was added in new version.

updateVCUSubtokenFactory(address).notice: Meant to update interface if it ever needs to change, although unlikely given it uses Proxies
